Posts.Content: May 9, 2012 07:36AM vivirasselena wrote: I was diagnosed with BC two weeks after my little brother died of a brain tumor.  Yeah.  I was in complete shock and mourning...I believe it was the only way I could have made it through was with humor. I made a video about my story and submitted it to Dr. Phil.......it has gone viral.  I hope it helps others make it through.  Two times in one family is just not right.  But if I can do this...........you and your sister can, too. Love and laughter, michele  http://www.firstpost.com/topic/disease/breast-cancer-dr-phil-make-me-a-star-in-my-own-lifemichele-torres-video-Cp4cOM9uIQ4-50861-1.html

Posts.Content: May 9, 2012 11:14AM - edited May 9, 2012 11:15AM by vivirasselena Anything I can do to help make this journey easier for someone else. That's what I would like out of this whole thing. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp4cOM9uIQ4   love, michele
Posts.Title: Sister and I just diagnosed within a week of each other bevg49 AnewBeginning

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2012 04:21PM - edited Jan 28, 2012 04:23PM by vivirasselena I lost my hair in the second week of treatment.  I did the same.......went and got THE CUTEST PIXIE cut, had it for about a week....then it started to fall out in the shower.  I then took my horse clippers and it was gone. I would run my hands through it........and (especially around the nape of the neck) it just shed like crazy. I got a "real wig" from the American Cancer Society.....but never wore it.  I just bought crocheted beanies.....super soft cashmere beanies......then switched to RIDICULOUS wigs...like a Wendy's wig....Elvis wig.....GIANT afro....bee hive....oompa loompa...anything. I should post them....they really gave me a sense of power and everyone looked forward to seeing what hideous wig I'd come in with next. It took me a while to find my humor, but I did......and am now featured all over Georgia Cancer Specialists.  It seemed to be a great upper to those around me, and gave me control! Hang in there......yes, it's painful and terrifying to not see yourself in the mirror....but it will pass. Take good care of yourself. michele
Posts.Title: How did you deal with losing your hair? taraw413 lorenar

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2012 07:03PM - edited Jan 29, 2012 07:14PM by vivirasselena Hey Tara...... yes mine came back COMPLETELY different!  and, I just love it!  kinda started with some peach fuzz....then thick as a brick with waves/curls all over the place! I remember asking my BS.."Will I lose my hair?"...Yes...."Are you sure?"....Yes.  "Positive?" Yes. So I just went with it.....do get yourself some warm caps to wear to bed....a bald head is cold I let mine grow back and left it natural. my profile pic is the final product....before it was long, kinda wavy and light brown. boring. I'm keepin it this way. Harder for me was losing eyebrows and eyelashes.....but that doesn't seem to be standard for everyone
Posts.Title: How did you deal with losing your hair? taraw413 lorenar

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2012 02:49PM vivirasselena wrote: I can't tell you what to eat or not eat....but get a prescription for an antibiotic ointment called "Mupricin" and put it in your nose by  q-tip 5 days prior to surgery, My cousin (a BC survivor) and nurse told me about it....it will reduce your risk of ANY infections while in there It'll really add an extra layer of protection from germs.

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2011 12:23PM - edited Dec 17, 2011 12:26PM by vivirasselena I can top ya.....on top of my horrifying and painful radiation burn......I GOT SHINGLES!   Yup! My entire red chest blistered and itchy with shingles.  OMG Now, I have to go BACK under the knife as a squamous-cell carcinoma (skin cancer) has popped up on the radiated side of my chest. It's a RARE complication from radiation burns.  AND I JUST HAD REPLACEMENT SURGERY December 5th! Just damn

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2011 10:41PM vivirasselena wrote: YES! get VALTREX..and take it prophylacticly (as a preventative) My dermo says it should be standard procedure before we start chemo and radiation.
Posts.Title: SHINGLES!!!!!!!!! vivirasselena gale1525

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2011 10:50PM vivirasselena wrote: The Valtrex helped clear them up....but I'm still BURNED horribly, so I've been off rads for almost two weeks.  I actually had SHINGLES ON TOP OF THE BURN!!!!!! What the What?  Anyway, I my oncologist got me to a dermo who prescribed a wonderful steroid cream and it helps so much.  If you have a rash or shingles....get to a dermo and have them talk to your onco.  But you just gotta tough it through. Scheduled to resume rads tomorrow...but we'll see. Still pretty raw and painful. Love you all michele
Posts.Title: SHINGLES!!!!!!!!! vivirasselena gale1525

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2012 04:34PM vivirasselena wrote: I got a phone call saying "You have Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, I'm so sorry"...and I said "What's that?" Breast cancer. I say call them if you're on pins and needles.  It's your health.
Posts.Title: How did you hear biopsy results--phone or appt? frazzledmom schoolmom

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 09:00PM vivirasselena wrote: They've officially lowered the recommended age to 50 for the vaccine....however, Kasi, I would talk to your doctor about a preventative prescription for VALTREX.  My dermo who is close contact with my oncologist and radiation oncologist says it SHOULD BE MANDITORY!  a 1 Gram tablet 3x daily would have prevented this beastly, horrific, excruciating outbreak. It doesn't hurt to ask about the vaccine OR the Valtrex....but at least get the Valtrex. Let's TAKE CARE OF OURSELVES, ladies...... I love you all with all my heart.  You're my heroes! michele
Posts.Title: SHINGLES!!!!!!!!! vivirasselena gale1525

Again, I would encourage you to stay close to the ladies here.  Each one of us has been very close if not exactly where you are. love, michele
